note.note: Bound group reads ⲡⲉⲭ︤ⲥ︥ and begins in GL29 (the part not paralleled by XJ33-34)

translation.translation: Also traitors.
They are thieves and apostates, those who do these deeds.
The abominations in the holy places
What is the matter with a multitude of lamps that are left upon the lamp stands?
They do not burn because they are not good...
Also the one of the holy men and the faith which dwells in it, making them see their good deeds, and which makes light in the holy places.
It is not a man who is useful for him.
And he will not benefit himself.
How will he be useful?
To a necessary act, or while a name that is honored will profit from him, Judas was not useful to him alone--...
... that apostate to the Lord, saying: 'if man gains the whole world, he loses his soul'

note.note: page number ⲗⲇ visible in upper left margin of page

translation.translation: What will he give him in exchange for this soul?
But still he listened to him saying 'one of you will betray me'.
And he was not ashamed, nor did he pity him, he led himself astray alone for thirty silver-- ...

translation.translation: ... gave him alone down to a snare of the devil.
For money, oh would that gold did not exist!
Still again we receive it in plenty in making God give it to us for some purpose.
But to bear the judgment for it.
It is lawlessness.
Would that gold did not exist and they would not hand over the righteous one for silver and -- ...
